text:
Third Avenue, north from and including 17th Street. At 190 Third Avenue, adjoining the N.W. corner of 17th Street, is the German-American Athletic Club, or Scheffel Hall, known for its popular restaurant.

May 21, 1934.

P. L. Sperr.

E. 17th Street, north side, west from Third Avenue, to and across Irving Place. The low ornate structure at the right (No. 143 East) is now occupied by a Greek Orthodox Church. It was formerly Scheffel Hall, a German restaurant, owned and operated by one, William Allaire. View No. 2 shows this detail and its adjoining structure No. 141.

June 1938
Views 1 and 2

George D. Chinn

E. 17th Street, north side, west from Third Avenue, to and across Irving Place. The low ornate structure at the right (No. 143 East) is now occupied by a Greek Orthodox Church. It was formerly Scheffel Hall, a German restaurant, owned and operated by one, William Allaire. View No. 2 shows this detail and its adjoining structure No. 141.
